user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_ObjectIdIteratorGetNext:
```c
bool OS_ObjectIdIteratorGetNext(OS_object_iter_t *iter)
{
    OS_common_record_t *record;
    bool                got_next;

    got_next           = false;
    iter->token.obj_id = OS_OBJECT_ID_UNDEFINED;

    do
    {
        ++iter->token.obj_idx;
        if (iter->token.obj_idx >= iter->limit)
        {
            break;
        }

        record = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(iter->base, iter->token);
        if (iter->match == NULL || iter->match(iter->arg, &iter->token, record))
        {
            iter->token.obj_id = record->active_id;
            got_next           = true;
        }
    } while (!got_next);

    return got_next;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_ObjectIdIteratorGetNext:
static inline osal_index_t OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_idx;
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
record = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(iter->base, iter->token);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No. The fragment calls OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(iter->base, iter->token) which (based on provided code and typical usage) retrieves a record from a table and does not call OS_ObjectIdIteratorGetNext. The only nearby function shown, OS_ObjectIndexFromToken, is a small static inline that returns token->obj_idx and does not call OS_ObjectIdIteratorGetNext. There is therefore no direct or indirect self-call in the shown fragment. (Only if OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET were implemented such that it called OS_ObjectIdIteratorGetNext would Rule 17.2 be violated; no such implementation is present in the given code.)
